newsitem.title: USA: CSCE world sugar ends weaker in rangebound trade.
newsitem.headline: CSCE world sugar ends weaker in rangebound trade.

text.p: CSCE world sugar futures settled lower as the market consolidated Thursday's gains in an otherwise featureless session, trading sources said.
"This is a typical inside day where players are letting the dust settle after a 31-point range yesterday," a floor source said.
He noted some light trade buying in the May/July spread, which has remained steady despite recent volatility, and outright buying in May from the low of 10.81 cents.
Market sources said the trade still has some short covering to do, while the speculators have covered a large portion of their short positions this week.
"That may relieve some of the downward pressure and should call for a test at the upper-end of the trading range soon," a floor source said.
The overhead target for May was seen at 11.05 cents. The contract climbed to a high of 11.01 on Thursday.
Refiner pricing around 10.86 cents capped gains from midday, another trader said.
Volume was estimated at 7,478 lots compared to Thursday's official 19,999 lots.
May closed 0.07 cent lower at 10.83 cents, having ranged from 10.92 to 10.81 cents.
Open interest in most-active May fell 1,348 lots to 62,253 lots as of Thursday's close.
